snippet: Thomas Gioeli, a reputed Colombo crime boss, and Dino Saracino, accused of being a hit man, were found guilty of a host of racketeering charges.
abstract: Federal jury acquits Thomas Gioeli and Dino Saracino, reputed Colombo crime family associates, of six gangland killings, including the 1997 fatal shooting of New York City police officer Ralph C Dols; both men are convicted, however, on charges of racketeering and conspiracy to commit murder.
lead_paragraph: Thomas Gioeli, a reputed Colombo crime boss, and Dino Saracino, accused of being a hit man, were found guilty of a host of racketeering charges.

headline.seo: Thomas Gioeli, Reputed Mobster, Is Convicted of Murder Plots
headline.main: Two Are Cleared in ’97 Killing of an Officer but Convicted of Plotting Mob Murders
headline.print_headline: Two Are Cleared in ’97 Killing of an Officer but Convicted of Plotting Mob Murders
